title: Do 1st year MBBS students of AIIMS Bhopal go for any trip? - Quora
tags: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Bhopal
All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS)
Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery Degrees

response.answer_text: Yesss! A big big yess. Although, the college do not organize the trips per se, but we students sponsor on our own and run away for mental peace. 😂 The best part for studying in Bhopal is that you will get a river, a hill station, a waterfall everything in the vicinity. Here are the places where our 2019 batch went to: 1)Upper lake How could I have forgotten this! Bhopal being the city of lakes, Upper lake is the largest of them.   2)Mahadev Paani The students who could not go to home for Diwali, planned a very spontaneous trip to this waterfall, nearly 30 km from our college. Yeah, we all are looking cartoons in this.    3)Panchmarhi hill station Boys went there right after the 1st end-sems. Girls felt rushing to home more important, after all family is the major stress reliever. Its 4 hrs ride. And trains are easily available.  4)Kerwa dam Girls being jealous, went here after we got together for 2nd sem. It's beautiful place, and one can click awesome candid-nature photography. 17km away from campus.   5)Crescent water park and Kanha fun city Boys also went to water parks via Uber/Ola  6) Bhopal Mela Yeah, it's an annual mela with lot's of amusement rides, street market and food stalls spread over acres of area. It's fun!  There are frequent visits to Malls, Markets nearby, not worth mentioning.We would have gone to many other and farther places, had Corona pandemic would not have occurred. Sigh! Now we are only outing on video calls!

Ah! Adventure! Okay, let’s do this. No college life is complete without going out with your friends, yet this going out can be of different types! Now, the college doesn’t “officially” organise these trips, but that’s the beauty of this venture. It’s the first bridge from adolescence to adulthood, a type of responsibility you want to have, and our students take a lot of it. Let’s explore, quite literally.  Long Trips -After the first semester exams, we were all thrilled to be done and get back home, or at least, get back a sense of pagalpanti, madness and adventure back into our system like an IV glucose drip. So, as many students began to depart, finding their way back home for the winter vacations, some of us stayed back. We started the journey with a BonFire, with all those batch mates that remained, we whipped up a concoction of firewood, dry leaves, old deodorants and a whole lot of flammable material to have a night of a lifetime. Then struck an idea, an idea we were so thrilled for, an idea that took the air out of our lungs, an idea that was so foggy, that idea was so high, that Idea was Pachmarhi, a hill station, perfect for a refreshing, rejuvenating location for retaining mental equilibrium after our exams, and God (probably as close to the heavens as I’ll ever get because this city floats in the clouds!) was it fun!  Credits, MP Tourism.      Mahadev Paani, Now, this may sound like a very energetic, vibrant waterfall but due to its proximity to AIIMS, serves as the perfect excuse for a one day trip. An exciting trek, filled with rendezvous with natures’ old human ancestors, mountain top shops, a temple carved into the substance of the hill, and the dripping water that keeps you happy and waters your dried up soul, Mahadev paani is truly magical. It’s not the water that brims the falls, it's not the iconic algae, it’s not the beautiful water carved pebbles, it's not the cold water that makes you freeze, its not the sunset that makes the water fall in golden orange threads, it's not the temple with it’s ringing bells, it’s none of that. It’s the bonding you get with your batchmates, as you help them and they help you, trek across huge boulders, save you from slipping on algae and hurting yourself, dancing under the cascade of water and singing with them, laughing with them, water fights, changing awkwardly in public, and finally, falling asleep on their shoulders in the bus back, knowing, you’re safe here, we’re all family. As Naina rightly said in Yeh Jawani hai Diwani, I didn’t know if Mahadev or Bhairav was there, but there’s one wish I’d wanted to ask for two, and my wish was simple, “My family”. Here I had, a new set of individuals who’d accompany me in this phase of life.  The Primitive ancestors, I’d mentioned.       Medium Sized TripsNow, Bhopal is a city full of history, nature and a pinch of modernity. This gives the students a wide non-exhaustive spectrum of places to visit, revisit and explore! Upper Lake. Now, Bhopal unearths the beauty of mother nature by its lush greenery and its magnificent lakes and waterbodies. Commonly called the city of lakes, it has 17 lakes and 4 dams, where Upper Lake stands out from the rest from being one of Asia’s largest man-made water bodies. It's so massive, that when one tries to find Bhopal on google maps, it's said that one first looks for the lake and then zooms in around it (Of course, one may just use the search bar, but where’s the fun in that!). With every airport visit, one travels the banks of Upperlake via VIP road, to just be in awe of its breathtaking beauty. There are multiple other restaurants, colleges, street food places or just places to stop and watch “Waqt to guzarte hue” Hillside restaurants adorn the beauty of the lake, during sunsets and sunrises, the bordered lights that shimmer from the VIP road, the lights from the ferry boats and Balloons, the camera lights and street lights that lead you astray, dragged by its sheer beauty, we’ve spent hours here, lost, immersed in its beauty. The lake being pretty close to the campus serves as the perfect location of cycling rides, scooter rides with friends or a share auto gang with a bunch of friends or a whole bus with the whole class! The routes may be infinite, but the destination always sends you in wow. This serves as a happy place, regardless of the time of the month. From cheap street food to one of the best Chai you’ll have, to Pizzas and Pasta to fancy Gourmet Restaurants to Tea Villas and more! Enjoy everything at the comfort of your choice at the same breathtaking view of the lake.     Apart from this, There’s Kerwa Dam, Shahpura lake, Kaliasod Dam that is equally just beautiful. These, being all close to the city, make not only the destination, but also the Journey beautiful.     Short TripsIt’s 12am, you’re hungry and the mess is closed. You make your way to the Doctors Canteen, grab some snacks and take your scooter out for a ride with your friends and the CITY AWAITS. From midnight Poha-Jalebi, Chai, Parathas, Chaat, Bhopal has everything near AIIMS. Let’s say, you’re bored. You just wanna go out to eat? The cuisine is never a problem, not for your taste buds, not for your wallet. From local street food, that’s safe, to amazing food at Shahpura, to world-class food in Gourmet restaurants (Trust me, you’ll never need this) to literally anything. A city where even gourmet meets the streets, its Ratatouille come to life, only, without the rats. Let’s say, it’s been a bad day in college and you wanna go out to get some peace of mind? AIIMS Bhopal has a solution to that too! From Extravagant malls, Cinemas, Restaurants, Museums, Historical Sites, Temples, Churches, Mosques, but this you’ll find in every city you go to. As many colleges may say, we have malls in our city, etc, I’m not going to try to sell AIIMS Bhopal to you, I assure you, whichever college you get, even if it's in Mumbai/Delhi or any hotspot, the beauty of any city, any event, nothing you do is legendary as long as your friends aren’t there to see it!       Now, AIIMS being just a stone throw away from the Habib Ganj railway station permits students to travel very very easily to almost anywhere, from Delhi to Danushkodi, Gujrat to Gangtok. If you want to hit the roads, Bhopal has one of the most organised traffic lanes, one specific to cycling, general traffic, busses (so, never worry about traffic jams, busses have their own roads!) and layby roads open to all for quick turns and highways, all adorned with plants on either side to keep you company and in fresh air! There are so many many more places we go to, from Dushera Maidaan, Campion road, Aura mall, Aashima, multiple museums, you can go to the tropic of cancer, go to Khana national park, go to Indore, and more. Yes, it’s medicine, yes it’s a lot to study. But, we always find our time, almost every day for some, weekly for many.  We also have our own campus movie nights, Bonfire nights, sometimes we just bunk and chill, sunset drives, early morning jogs and sunrise treks, paddy field walks, in campus Nescafe walks, waterpark tours, there’s a lot of life outside books and a lot of it in learning too! We also go to another campus’ and colleges for their fests, from Delhi to all our sister AIIMS’ and to Bhopal Colleges! So, if some colleges tell you they’ve great fests, love that and go to their fest too! No one’s going to stop you, you’ll be your only limitation to happiness. We hope where ever you do join, you become great doctors. You’re always welcome to AIIMS B, as students of AIIMS B or just as well-wishers. With love, AIIMS Bhopal.
